Firstly, it is important to note that George Fox was a leader and founder of the Quaker religious movement. Quakers believe in non-violence and reject physical punishment such as stoning. 

Furthermore, George Fox himself emphasized the importance of love, forgiveness, and non-resistance to evil. He believed that violence only perpetuates more violence and that true change comes through spiritual transformation and inner peace.

Therefore, based on his beliefs and teachings, it is highly unlikely that George Fox would have supported stoning as a form of punishment. The answer is (B) no.

First, who is George Fox? George Fox was the founder of the Quaker movement in the 17th century. 

Next, what is stoning? Stoning is a method of execution where a group of people throw stones at a person until they die. 

Based on Quaker teachings, George Fox would not support stoning. Quakers believe in non-violence and the sanctity of human life. Stoning goes against these beliefs and values. Additionally, Quakers believe in forgiveness and redemption, rather than punishment and retribution. Therefore, the answer is (B) no - George Fox would not support stoning.
